37934571.review:
An indie classic that I had long been hearing of, I just didn't take the time to check out Cave Story until recently. It is as good as everyone says it is: a Metroidvania game developed by a single person which has been hugely influential. Cave Story is challenging but rewarding. The atmosphere (and music in particular) feel like the kind of thing that you might've grown up with, if you played games during the 16-bit era.

I found the story, in particular the dialogue, disorienting. From what I've read online, this is due to a sub-standard English translation. Unfortunately my Japanese isn't good enough to use that, but this was the only downside of the game for me.

Toward the end of the game, Cave Story gets very difficult. Completing it after dying many times was deeply satisfying. If you enjoy this type of game, this is worth playing.

37851233.review:
This wonderful indie run-and-gun style action game was a one man labor of love project. It was released as freeware in 2004. Gamers immediately recognized its brilliance, fan translated it into english, and fan campaigns to try to reward the creator started. Fortunately he connected with a small developer and updated his game so that he could officially release it and help support his family. I played it three times as freeware and have paid for it and played it again multiple times since. I love it.

It's endearing charm, great gameplay, absolutely wonderful soundtrack, and atmosphere never fail to impress me each time I play it again. It reminds me of the initial joy I found finding and playing something completely new and unexpected as a boy. Somehow it retains that happy sense of charm again and again.

The secrets, the beautiful soundtrack, the joy of discovery when you come to each new zone… What a fantastic game.

10/10

37626373.review:
I'm mostly doing this recommendation on the basis of doing an own category on the Steam awards for best Doujin/Japanese Indie game, though if this was nominated outright for best Indie of all-time, I would give it a vote in a heartbeat.

Seriously, I love this game. I really need to formulate a proper review so I can properly describe why I feel that way, though to make it short, although it can be quite infuriating on the difficulty and vagueness in certain actions, it makes up for it in a big way with the fantastic run-and-shoot gameplay, great art (both the original pixel art and remastered), excellent music, likeable and/or interesting characters and even a story that starts pretty basic but takes a turn that deceive the look of the game. It also has quite a bit replay value thanks to the multiple endings and secrets.

That aside, there's a few versions and ports of this game released over the years, with this being touted as a definitive version of sorts. I have to agree to that sentiment, as it has the option to play with the original or the remastered graphics (from the Wii Ware release), the option to three soundtracks (original, remastered from WiiWare and another remastered apparently from the 3DS version), the bonuses of the Wii Ware release, other bonuses included here and an extra potential for modding. Although you can still download the original freeware version and patch its early english translation (the one here is done by Nicalis), I think this is worth buying and the content justifies the price.

36897940.review:
Oh my god i haven't reviewed this game yet.

Anyways 10/10

Since before i can even remember probably, i've always loved games. There have been games that are amazing, but just not there yet. I remember back when i had a wii, I discovered a game: Cave Story. I got the game, not expecting much but still anticipating some fun. Countless playthroughs, endless amounts of fun, and six years later, I continue to marvel and enjoy this masterpeice that is merely a 2 hour long game. Its beautiful, each and every sprite is unique and has its own personallity. Each boss is unique in that they appear in different areas, some being optional. Each has their own history, their own story. The scenes are beautiful and the level design doesnt get much better. While you could aregue its a little straight forward and hints at its own objective, there are always secrets like invisible hearts. Whether or not you play it for fun or professionally. It never gets old, until you play every ending, get every last achievement, discover every secret, the game is fun. You could do the same run 100 times and you'd still find something funnier or new.

This game has taught me alot. And I hope there will one day be a sequel or something along those lines that i'll discover and enjoy.

Again 10/10 (11/10 really)

151434668.review:
My favourite game of all time. I see it as the very definition of a perfect indie game. 'nuff said.

Classic soundtrack is, of course, the only soundtrack you need to hear.

My Steam hours are only a fraction of how much time I actually spent on this masterpiece. I lost count of how many times I replayed this game from scratch on different platforms, and never got bored of it. Every single time I got hooked for hours, even if I only needed to play for 5 minutes to check if a Switch emulator is properly configured, or if RetroArch is working on an old tablet. There's even a Sega Mega Drive / Genesis port out there, and I couldn't miss an opportunity to play it as well.

There is no reason to buy this specific version though, as many reviewers said. Seriously, there are so many options to choose from, just pick any of them and enjoy.
